intro: Siphonychia erecta, commonly known as the upright siphonychia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, which are usually greenish-white in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Siphonychia erecta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or shaded areas.
